listing.notes: Title: Squirrel Away Publisher: Mare Infinitus Games Language(s): English German French Dutch

boardgame.name: Terror Zone of the Astro Creep
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You wake up in cryo stasis upon a spacefaring server farm.

In a nightmarish surreal turn of events, your ship's android gives you the bad news.

HE has boarded your ship, and every moment he is spawning abominations that will test your sanity and resolve.

Can you escape the TERROR ZONE OF THE ASTRO CREEP?

boardgame.name: Kaichū-Shi
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this system-agnostic Sci-Fi supplement and love-letter to Mushishi by Yuki Urushibara, your characters play as frontier doctors called Kaichū-Shi or Parasite Masters.

They'll exploring dark forests and researching parasitic organisms, known as Kaichū, that exist in a classification somewhere between plants and insects. Heal colonists and blue collar workers who fall sick with mysterious ailments, exhibiting symptoms that vary from minor to life-threatening.

Many of the organisms are only visible when viewed through specific spectrums of light. Some only partially exist in this universe. When viewed, they are often semi-corporeal, ethereal creatures that bend light around them as they float and crawl around.

To play you'll need:

This Pamphlet
A set of polyhedral dice (specifically d10's)
The TTRPG of your choice


CW: This module contains elements relating to sicknesses and treatments and may not be suitable for all audiences

boardgame.name: Children of Ire World Setting
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A fantasy setting for Index Card RPG, created by RUNEHAMMER GAMES. Users should already know how to play ICRPG, have the free Quickstart Guide, or own the ICRPG CORE 2E book.

In the ICRPG timeline, this setting takes place many years before the World of Alfheim known in both the CORE 2E and WORLDS books, and is focused on the continent of Ire where magic is new, the land untamed, and the folks uncivilized.

Although it's already easy to grasp, this supplement attempts to simplify ICRPG a little more for both newcomers and children. It is sprinkled with small suggestion boxes throughout and the monsters section contains separate blocks with simplified stats. Bio-forms are boiled down to 4 choices while Classes are condensed into 5 choices with extra loot options. Most subjects in the book are listed in easy-roll-table quantities. Inside the book is a World Primer covering the 3 main zones of Ire, 16 monsters, a black/white World Map of early Ire, new magic spells, and an additional 100 item loot table.

boardgame.name: Road to Salvation
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A supplement for ICRPG's weird west setting, World of Ghost Mountain by RUNEHAMMER GAMES. Contains more character classes, milestones, weapons, magic spells, a campaign setting, multiple adventure threads, a world map, mini-games (dice/card), loot tables, monster templates, and a character sheet.

boardgame.name: World of Aurora Campaign Setting
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A fantasy/pirate setting for Index Card RPG, by RUNEHAMMER GAMES. Users should already know how to play ICRPG, have the free Quickstart Guide, or own the ICRPG CORE book.

Aurora's first edition was a free supplement with much less content, detail, and proper artwork. 2E has been rebuilt from the ground up and includes a commissioned map, class art, and monster art.

This world setting contains 7 character classes each with 2 subclasses, 13 monsters, 5 adventure hooks, a world map, world outlines for each region, a loot table, a character sheet, and a ship sheet. Ships have been redesigned as well, taking advantage of using PC's in their best suited crew positions.

This setting also includes new milestone paths, weapons, and magic spells. Your purchase will contain zip folders with tokens for digital play, full-res maps, a DM screen, and printable character/monster cards.

boardgame.name: Grozhny Corvette
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grozhny Corvette drops and collects sensor drones. It provides extensive tactical data for the Navy, planetary and traffic data for the civil authorities and survey data for colonial planners.
It has good performance for customs enforcement and heavy weapons for anti-piracy duties. The Grozhny is a useful ship for many roles. Varients include a priority cargo carrier and missile boat. Grozhny Corvettes can be found all over the sector, the crews sorting out problems and working to furthur their side's interests.

boardgame.name: The Heart of Winter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Heart of Winter is a 5e adventure for 2nd level characters.

Characters find themselves transported to the winter realm of Faerie where two powerful entities contest the fate of the solstice.

Jokul, the embodiment of Winter, has captured Kringle, the embodiment of the Winter solstice. With Kringle out the way, who will stop Jokul from unleashing an everlasting winter upon the worlds of Faerie and men?

boardgame.name: The Sleep of Reason
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Heart of Winter is a 5e adventure for 2nd level characters.

Characters find themselves transported to the winter realm of Faerie where two powerful entities contest the fate of the solstice.

Jokul, the embodiment of Winter, has captured Kringle, the embodiment of the Winter solstice. With Kringle out the way, who will stop Jokul from unleashing an everlasting winter upon the worlds of Faerie and men?

boardgame.name: Monsters of the Deep!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Clain Hoake stood on the pier, one foot up on a wooden crate as he lit his pipe and puffed smoke rings into the pink dusk sky. Finally, things were returning to normal. Finally, the war was ending.

The shockwave broke his peaceful tobacco enjoyment, the pipe dropping from his mouth, through a gap in the planks, and with a plop, hit the sea. “Darn, not another one…” As Clain looked up from the pier to the roiling waters, he saw what could only be described as a massive turtle coasting along the crest of a tidal wave, an army of jellyfish balanced precariously on its shell, while a glowing seahorse trumpeted the sea monsters’ arrival.

Clain blinked. He was sure that was just tobacco in his pipe, but he couldn’t believe his eyes. He and his friends had only just driven back vile werelobsters, predatory shark clans, and communist crab people, and now a new wave of monsters rose up from the deep to flood humanity with their briny aggression!

Monsters of the Deep! is an expansive bestiary for They Came from Beneath the Sea!, including a variety of new monsters big and small to include in your stories as goons, or to base your plots around as central antagonists.

As with the threats introduced in They Came from Beneath the Sea!, the monsters in this book can be played for farce, with the Director emphasizing the rubbery costumes coming apart at the seams, or for horror, with the Director describing in precise detail what the Algae of Doom does to its victims (and it isn’t pretty!).

They Came from Beneath the Sea! uses the Storypath System.

Monsters of the Deep! includes:
• Disgusting Destroyers such as Billy Skibbers, the Colossomantids, and the Siliclones!
• Edentulous Enslavers including the Algae of Doom, Poseidon, and the Box Jellies!
• Insidious Invaders including the Sea Dragons, Dire Sea Sponges, and Jelly Men!
• Putrid Primordials such as the Turtledon, the Creeping Coral, and the Gullbatross!
• Spumy Spies not limited to Melvis and the Deep-Water Band, Mr. Frosty, and the Red Coral Society!
• Terrible Terrestrial Threats including the Red Death, Reverend Aquarius, and B.A.K.E!
boardgame.rpg: They Came From Beneath the Sea!

boardgame.name: Asian Spell Compendium (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic of the Imperial East

The Asian Spell Compendium brings you over 100 amazing new magical spells for Pathfinder Second Edition inspired by the mysteries of the Far East, from the frozen tundra and boreal forests of the far north to the serpent jungles of the south. Drawing from the myths, legends, and lore of China, Japan, India, Southeast Asia, Siberia, and more, you'll find tons of new spells for every casting tradition and class, from ancestral wrath to word of pain and all spells in between. You'll see offensive spells like flame shuriken, tiger trap, and blessed jade strike and defensive incantations like spirit ward, toad's kiss, and sublime detachment, from minor magics like awful apparition, drowsy fireflies, and punji pit to mighty enchantments like divine wind, rain of sacred lotus petals, terra cotta legion, and the deadly marvelous chopsticks. Whether you favor arcane, divine, occult, or primal spells, tapping the power of elements or magic of the mind, you'll find an incredible array of new and inventive spells perfect for introduction into an all-Asian campaign or one that simply draws a bit here and there from the magic and mystery of the unapproachable east.

boardgame.name: Codex Guide to the Medieval Baltic Volume II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is the very cold night of February third, in the year of 1454 in a region of the far north called Prussia. As the snow falls on the cobblestone streets of the city of Danzig, from the shadow of the 6 story crane in the harbor, to the vast city walls on the Radunia canal, something very unusual is afoot. All over the city, the German-speaking citizens are arming themselves, bucking straps on their armor, sharpening the edges of their swords, testing the points of thier halberds, gathering up crossbow bolts and measuring out gunpowder into little paper cartrdige packets. Some of them are praying, others are checking special talismans they wear for protection. The next morning they will rise up against their own overlords in the Teutonic Order, storm their castles and redoubts, and drive the Brother Knights out of the town gates. The same thing is going to happen in 18 other towns and cities throughout Prussia. These merchants and shopkeepers, shipwrights, furriers, butchers, weavers and cutlers have together formed an alliance called the Prussian Confederation, and they are determined to fight for their freedom.

Their new chosen ally, the Kingdom of Poland, now voluntarily under the rule of a half pagan Lithuanian King, has promised them their autonomy in exchange for access to the Baltic Sea. The Teutonic Knights will not take this lying down, and are certain to rally all of their Brother Knights, to invoke ancient treaties, call in favors, and use all of their deep connections in Latin Europe, to summon Crusaders and mercenaries to help them crush the rebellion.

This is the beginning of the 13 Years War. Who will win this titanic struggle? It is a matter of record. But this is a story known to very few in the English speaking world. For gamers, historical fencers, re-enactors, and those interested in either history or fantasy, it is a gripping period of wild adventure reckless courage, and devious cunning. It is now accessible to you - a new universe to enter and explore, to learn and borrow ideas from. Far richer than most genre settings you may be familiar with, and full of useful details from every day life to grand strategy and scenarios.

Codex Guide to the Medieval Baltic is your guide to Northern Europe in the 15th Century. Volume One covered the estates of the knights, burghers and peasants, the details of life in a medieval Free City, and the weapons, tactics and strategies of war.

The Codex Guide to the Medieval Baltic, Volume Two covers law in the medieval world, the estates of the Church and the Universities, the occult underworld and pagan religious practices of Northeast Europe in the 15th Century. It provides historical narratives about the kingdoms, duchies, city-states, and small republics which made up the patchwork of political entities in this era. Learn about the Kingdoms of Poland and Denmark, the machinations and strategems of the mighty Teutonic Order, the internecine struggles of the Russian City States and the strategies of conquest and domination employed by the Mongols of the Golden Horde and the Turks of Ottoman Empire. Then read short biographies of 33 people who inhabited this region five centuries in the past. Get to know actual historical alchemists, spies, assassins, mercenary captains, warriors, pirates and robber knights of this fascinating and turbulent era.

The Codex Guide to the Medieval Baltic Volume II, now, at last available for purchase, is part 2 of a general historical overview of the Baltic region in 1456 AD suitible for use by gamers, historical fencers, re-enactors, military historians, and anyone curious about life in Northeastern Europe 500 years in the past.

boardgame.name: Cthulhu Hack - Initiative !
boardgame.description:
User Summary'

"Cthulhu Hack - Initiative !" is a Quick Start book for Cthulhu hack. It contains a summary of the rules, pregenerated characters and a Scenario "Awamaru's treasure".

boardgame.name: Sternenschweif: Der silberne Stern
boardgame.description:
The Silver Star is the brightest star in the twinkling night sky. Its power allows unicorns to live on earth. But suddenly Laura and her unicorn Star Tail discover that the light of the star is getting weaker and weaker. Help Laura and Starletail find all of the Silver Star's starspikes before its light goes out! Only together can the players make the magical star sparkle again and save all the unicorns.

In this game all children play together and try to beat the game by finding the prongs of the silver star before it reaches the end of the timeline and its light goes out forever. The game lasts about 20 minutes and is suitable for players aged 6 and up.

-translation of publisher's website

boardgame.name: Masters of Math: Minus Edition
boardgame.description:
Masters of Math – Minus Edition is a card educational game played by two to four players. This game helps children to learn subtraction basics up to 10 and quickly calculate tasks in their head. It also practices the comparison of numbers: bigger, smaller, equal.

The object of the game is to be the fastest to solve math equations in your head correctly and to get rid of all your cards. The person who calculates the quickest and has the card with the correct solution puts the corresponding solution card on top of the equation card. The player obtains this pair of cards and places it in front of themselves. The player who collected the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Roll for the Galaxy: reDrewno Insert
boardgame.description: This game organizer is compatible with Roll for the Galaxy. The insert fits the Portal Games edition and the Games Factory edition from wspieram.to, i.e. thicker player boards and thicker dice boards. There is also place for cups with soundproofing inside (after gently pressing them into each other). It will also fit Ambition expansion. Containers with dice and tokens are closed - nothing will fall out when you arrange the box vertically.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Roll for the Galaxy: Terraforming Colony/Diversified Economy Promo Tile

boardgame.name: Orbital
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

Orbital is a sci-fi RPG of precarious spaces amid interstellar war.

ORBITAL gives us airlocks and control panels, pensive faces looking out into the cosmos, improvised fixes for critical systems, military-sponsored subterfuge, warm embraces in the cold vacuum, frantic struggles in zero-gravity and unknowable ancient technology, asking WHAT DO YOU DO NEXT?

boardgame.name: Gods of the Black
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is a war in heaven.
Posthumanity has fallen. Something found them out void, and its shadow fell across them. Now they are fell demons of the black, bloody-handed avatars of madness. Humanity cowers behind the Tangle and the meagre protection it provides. But the sickness that dwells within the gods drives them endlessly, and there are many cracks their avatars can slip through.
Know them, child, and fear their signs.

boardgame.name: The Last Nebula
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A hex crawl through a psychedelic nebula. Discover an ancient expedition to the nebula, meet space pirates and discover creatures of the interstellar void.

The Last Nebula is a light 8-page sci-fi horror hex crawl compatible with the Mothership RPG (Tuesday Knight Games), or usable with your favorite sci-fi tabletop RPG system. Works well with one-shots as well as a part of a longer campaign.

Maps of The Last Nebula
Random table for travelling in the nebula
Space pirates, space whale and a space station
boardgame.rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

boardgame.name: Heads Will Roll
boardgame.description:
Everyone knows dragons love hoarding gold in their caves and laying waste to any would-be intruders. It turns out dragons also have designed their own game using the leftovers...

To play, take turns rolling a fistful of pieces out across the table and flicking your Shield through the scattered Skulls to earn (or lose) points. Hit the treasure chest to bank those points and add them to your total. First player to reach 21 points wins.

The game uses most of the same basic rules as Dragoon: Heads Will Roll but has some additions, changes, different physical components, and new art. If you dig D:HWR you'll be way into this.

-description from designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: ヒーフー!! (Hii Fuu!!)
boardgame.description:
ヒーフー!! (Hii Fuu!!) is a trick-taking game from Japan in which the aim is to win exactly two of the nine tricks as late as possible.

There are two main features: the scoring system and the choice of the initial hand. This makes for an exciting trick-taking game that can be enjoyed from the beginning to the end of the game.

The scoring system: if you do not score exactly two tricks, you score zero points. If you score three tricks, you are eliminated from the round and score zero points. If you score only zero or one trick at the end of the round, you score zero points. This can be a nerve-wracking dilemma.

How to choose your initial hand: Unlike most trick-taking games, the initial hand is decided by discarding a relatively large number of cards from the hand dealt. Each player's intentions are intertwined and each session can be different.

ヒーフー!! は9トリックのうちぴったり2トリックをなるべく遅く獲得することを目指すトリックテイキングゲームです。
大きな特徴は２つ、得点方式と初期手札の選び方です。これによりトリックテイキングゲームの楽しさをゲーム序盤から終盤まで楽しめるエキサイティングなゲームになっています。

得点方式：ぴったり2トリック以外は0点になってしまいます。3トリック獲得した時点でそのラウンドは脱落して0点、ラウンド終了時に0 or 1トリックのみの場合も0点です。2トリック時の点数もより後のトリックほど点数が高くなっており、ひりついたジレンマを味わうことが出来ます。
初期手札の選び方：通常のトリックテイキングゲームと違い、配られた手札から比較的多くのカードを捨てて初期手札を決めるゲームです。プレイヤーごとの意図が交錯しセッションごとに違った展開が楽しめます。
publisher's summary

listing.notes: New and sealed. Buyer pays shipping, CashApp preferred.

Brand new copy with English rules. Direct and official import from the publisher in Japan. We ship worldwide from California!
For faster ordering, please check an alternate listing on our online shop as well (PayPal and card payments accepted): https://www.bigcatgames.biz/product/hiifuu/102?cp=true&sa=false&sbp=false&q=false&category_id=6

boardgame.name: Die Schule der magischen Tiere: ermittelt – Klarer Fall, Murphy!
boardgame.description:
There is a lot of excitement in the magical pet shop! Several animals have disappeared without a trace overnight. No question that polar bear Murphy immediately starts investigating. But the master detective needs the help of the players.

In this cooperative game, players work closely together to track down the culprits. Only if the detectives cleverly combine Murphy's clues will they save the magical animals. Thus begins an exciting adventure in which each player plays his part in solving the case.

boardgame.name: Feuerwehrmann Sam: Allzeit bereit!
boardgame.description:
Fireman Sam and his friends are always ready to help the residents of Pontypandy.

On your turn, you roll the color die. Then you may take a puzzle tile from the center of the table that has the same colored dot as the rolled color. Each player may only take one puzzle tile per round. If you roll the color of which you already have the puzzle tile in front of you, you will not be able to take a tile in this round. Then it's the next player's turn. The first player to complete a puzzle wins the game.

boardgame.name: Die Geschichte vom kleinen Siebenschläfer, der nicht einschlafen konnte
boardgame.description:
Sleep, little dormouse, sleep! Everyone is getting ready for hibernation, only the little dormouse isn't tired at all yet. Who can help the little one? It's up to the players! They join in the search for valuable tips on how to fall asleep. In this board game, they move their game piece along the path and uncover memo cards that can help them. The matching motif was not found? Then the next player tries his luck.

On their way, the toddlers meet fox, nightingale, snail and co. who give everything to bring the dormouse to dreamland. Whoever reaches the last path map and discovers the card with the yawning dormouse is the winner! A wonderful party game with a story about sleeping and cuddling for toddlers, parents and grandparents.

boardgame.name: Stadt Land Würfelspaß
boardgame.description:
In this creative word and dice game, players try to find terms with the same initial letters as quickly as possible.

Everyone plays at the same time. Like in the well-known word game Scategories, the goal is to fill in all the squares and thus collect the most points at the end of the round. In Stadt Land Würfelspaß, however, new themes are rolled before the game, making the game varied and exciting!

boardgame.name: BEOWULF: Age of Heroes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

One of the oldest recorded stories in Western Europe, Beowulf is the ultimate tale of hero vs. monster – and now a dramatic, 5e setting.

Discover a fierce background of wild seas and savage monsters, of meadhalls and of heirloom swords that bear legendary names. Gain Followers, take Inspiration from unique Portents, and use our specially crafted tokens to guide your voyage along the Whale Road.

Play the ‘Hero’ class, and choose from six sub-classes based on your ability scores. You can be the mighty Bench-Breaker, the wily Riddle-Reaver, or the sturdy Ox-Blooded. And you can come from a range of setting-specific backgrounds: you might be the Chosen One, or Adrift and seeking answers. You may be an Avenger, or of Noble Blood.

Written and illustrated by a team of industry veterans, led by Jon Hodgson, (The One Ring, D&D, Warhammer Historical) BEOWULF: Age of Heroes features 272 pages of beautifully illustrated mythic setting, and evokes a legendary age of tales, poems and song.

Described by fans as the ‘best hack of 5e ever made’, and by games designer Will Hindmarch as something ‘really magical’, BEOWULF Age of Heroes is uniquely designed for duet play: one Hero and one GM (though it can still be played by a group). This means it’s very easy to get a game going and to keep it going, and it’s especially ideal for play over the internet.

With its feet firmly in the world’s favourite role-playing game, BEOWULF has been very carefully forged to follow the folklore, flow and feel of the original poem.

boardgame.name: Horror at Herrogate
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Word reaches our Hero that the remote fishing settlement of Herrogate, and the treasure seat of its lord Thorfinn, are plagued by a dreadful dréag. But is all quite as it seems?

Masterfully written by Marco Rafalà (The One Ring RPG, Star Trek Adventures, Lex Arcana) and beautifully illustrated by Jon Hodgson (The One Ring RPG, Dungeons and Dragons, Warhammer Historical), Horror at Herrogate is suitable for Heroes of level 3 to 4.

Full use of the scenario requires the BEOWULF: Age of Heroes book, though there are plenty of ideas to mine for other settings.

boardgame.name: BEOWULF: Age of Heroes - Pre-Generated Characters 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Four new characters for The Hermit's Sanctuary for BEOWULF: Age of Heroes! Each with full figure character art, a 5e character sheet, a choice of starting points for The Hermit's Sanctuary adventure.

Meet:

Blaedswith, the Karelian Amulet Witch
Ham Ansfeald, the Hero-Sailor
Waelwulf, the Doomed Monster-fighter
The Wolf Child

boardgame.name: Tomb Raider: Definitive Survivor Trilogy
boardgame.description: This is the complete edition of the Tomb Raider origin collection, containing the definitive editions of all three award-winning prequel Tomb Raider titles. Follow Lara Croft across the world as she grows into the Tomb Raider she was destined to be.

boardgame.name: Just Cause: Mobile
boardgame.description: Just Cause: Mobile for iOS and Android features some faces that will be familiar to fans of the franchise! As you start your journey as an agent, Rico Rodriguez & Annika Svensson will be among the mercenaries you’ll encounter, giving your player character missions and intel.

boardgame.name: Hitman Sniper Assassins
boardgame.description: From the Makers of the Acclaimed Hitman Sniper, we are proud to announce Project Hitman Sniper Assassins (working title) a wholly original Hitman story, with new playable assassins and brand-new gameplay features

boardgame.name: Black Hole: Kyrum
boardgame.description:
Black Hole is a dice and card game in Print and Play format.

Past, present, future, prepare to travel through time and space.

Explore the planets of Kyrum and attempt to piece together the history of Jaakub the explorer.

During a game, you will have to achieve a number of objectives, while keeping an eye on your resources.

Explore the "planet" cards to find different items that will help you in your task.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Black Hole est un jeu de dés et de cartes au format Print and Play.

Passé, présent, futur, préparez vous à voyager à travers le temps et l'espace.

Explorez les planètes de Kyrum et tentez de reconstituer l'histoire de Jaakub l'explorateur.

Lors d'une partie, vous devrez atteindre un certain nombre d'objectifs, tout en gardant un œil sur vos ressources.

Explorez les cartes "Planète" afin de trouver différents éléments qui vous aideront dans votre tâche.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Space Invaders (2022)
boardgame.description: Discover an exciting new augmented reality experience with the next Space Invaders game. Coming to mobile devices

boardgame.name: TOUHOU Spell Bubble
boardgame.description: Touhou Spell Bubble is a mix Puzzle Bobble’s (Bust a Move in North America) game design with Touhou Project’s characters and music enhanced by a line up of 40 voice actresses and illustrators and numerous music artists too.

boardgame.name: Darius Cozmic Revelation
boardgame.description: Darius Cozmic Revelation is a Darius compilation

boardgame.name: Lepanto 1571: A Sea Turned Red by Blood
boardgame.description:
October 7th, 1571
The calm Aegean sea is going to be, once again, the scene of one of the most important battles in history. The fleets of the Ottoman Empire and the Holy League, created by Pope Pius V, are ready to clash in the waters in front of the little town of Lepanto. At the end of the day, after one of the fiercest battles in the long history of naval combat, the Ottoman fleet breaks away following the loss of more than 150 ships and 30.000 men.
Now the sea is red, a sea turned red by blood.
400+ counters, 6 player aid cards, 3 maps, a rules book and a playerbook with examples of play.
—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Opened, examined, unpunched. Like new. Photos available on request. Shipping to US address will typically be about $15, inquire for foreign shipping. Thanks for looking!

boardgame.name: Life is Strange: True Colors
boardgame.description: A bold new era of the award-winning Life is Strange begins, with an all-new playable lead character and a thrilling mystery to solve!
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 The Game Awards Best Impact of the Year Winner
2021 The Game Awards Best Narrative of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Being Looked At
boardgame.description:
Being Looked At is a solo journaling game about being isolated by an experience you cannot share with anyone. It is a game about losing touch with reality and fixating on a threat no one else can see. It is about tapping into a primal fear of being stalked with no means of protecting yourself.

You play as a typical person living a typical life in a typical town. The only thing remarkable about you is that a fucked up guy looks at you. The uncertainty about this guy’s origin and motives are almost as disconcerting as him looking at you. To make matters worse, no one else seems to see him.


This game also requires a standard deck of 52 playing cards, a 6-sided die, 10 tokens, a tumbling block tower (optional), and a way of recording your play: a audio or video recording device is recommended, but pen and paper will also work.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Chosen
boardgame.description:
Chosen is a solo journaling RPG, made using the Wretched & Alone rules by Chris Bissette and Matt Sanders. In Chosen, you are hunted by a supernatural Entity that has destroyed your life and stolen you away to its forest domain. Will you survive this culmination of the Entity's plans? Or will you succumb?

Chosen is a game about isolation, will, and helplessness in the face of powers or events we perceive to be beyond our control. You may have suffered losses, such as the death of family or friends, as part of the Entity’s plans to weaken your spirit. You may have experienced events that make you question the very nature of reality. Now, you have been brought to the forest, and you can sense the Entity somewhere in the trees. It seems like everything has led to this moment and there is no way of defeating the Entity’s plans to possess you. Yet with luck and considerable will, you may yet survive.

Chosen is inspired by a number of horror movies, notably The Ritual, Hereditary, and Get Out.

This Game Requires:


A standard deck of playing cards with jokers.
A tumbling-block tower game is strongly suggested for optimal play.
A six-sided die.
10 small items to use as tokens, such as coins or teeth.
A means of journaling or recording your play session.


This game was made as part of the Wretched & Alone jam.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: BLASTER: Games Anthology 02
boardgame.description:
BLASTER – the independent wargaming anthology – returns! Five of wargaming’s most prolific indie designers bring you exclusive expansions for their awesome games as well as entirely new tabletop gaming experiences.

BLASTER: Volume 2 contains:

Mystic Skies - Mike Hutchinson and Sean Sutter - Imagine yourself as a powerful sorcerer, soaring above the desert on a magic carpet. Combining the nail-biting movement of Gaslands with brutal magic and combat systems, Mystic Skies is a complete and standalone wargame of high-speed magical duels, tower defence and monster hunting.

This Is Not A Test: Masters of the Wild (Part 2) - Joey McGuire - Following from our first installment of this expansion for This Is Not A Test, we now examine the lesser powers of the wild who can join your warband. From the the nefarious beast controller who psychically dominates creatures into subservience to the beast friend, a natural animal empath. We also include lesser versions of the tribal wildcaller of chimeric wildshaper. Finally, animal skills are introduced, which are really fun and thematic and give your warbands an animal appeal.

Shadowgrave, Part I – Joseph A. McCullough - What happens when the creatures of the Mythos invade Frostgrave, Ghost Archipelago, and Rangers of Shadow Deep? Rules for sanity, madness, and permanent mental damage! Includes a new scenario for each of the three games, plus a host of nefandous creatures!

Last Days: Evolutions – Ash Barker - Last Days: Evolutions brings new threats to your Post Apocalypse. You can totally re-theme your games of Last Days to include new types of the Undead or shift gears entirely to try to survive an unshackled AI collapsing civilization!

—description from the publisher

This PDF document presents print-and-play expansion modules for several miniatures games, noted above.
—user summary
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Frostgrave
Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago
Frostgrave: Second Edition
Last Days: Zombie Apocalypse
Rangers of Shadow Deep
This Is Not a Test: Post-Apocalyptic Skirmish Rules

boardgame.name: I Have Gone This Far
boardgame.description:
Who?
You have been a fraud all your life, or so you thought. Telling people about demons and devils, warning them, selling them worthless wards and trinkets. Little did you know, you were right all along. Demons do exist and one has possessed your charge, who lives with you since their parents died. One night, when you were working on some new trinkets filled with mosses and bark, your charge came down the stairs, an empty look on their face. Their eyes turned violet and you could no longer move.

Then they spoke, “In exchange for their soul I require many others. You will provide them for me. Take this book and deck, they will help you with your task. There is no way out of this, don’t toy with your charges life.”

What?
“I have gone this far” is a game about seeing how far you are willing to go to protect someone you love. It is about isolation, desperation and guilt.

You play a soothsayer, a charlatan, a trickster that has been preying on the fears of people for years now. You sell trinkets and read cards and tea leaves. You never believed in what you sold people. Now you do. It is on you to free your charge from possession or even banish the demon entirely.

How?
You will draw cards, roll dice and pull pieces from a tumbling block tower to generate prompts for your story. Each round of the game is a Ceremony in which you collect a soul and offer it to the demon, hoping they will free your charge. You will record each Ceremony by writing it down, recording audio or video or any other means you can think of.

Content Warning
The odds of "winning" this game are extremely low, please consider this before you buy or play it, you will likely not succeed. Even the best outcome will have bad consequences for the characters in the game. You will be asked to do terrible things and dealing with the guilt of these actions is part of the game. Stopping at any time is a valid way to end the game. You are also allowed to cheat and break the rules the demon gives you. Be creative to reduce the harm you cause.

This game includes the following, their intensity depends on you:


Ritual sacrifice
Harm to innocents
Loss of control
Manipulation
Intense guilt
Children in danger


What you need

Rider-Waite tarot deck of cards (alternatively Standard Poker Deck)
A single 6-sided die
A tumbling block tower (alternatives available)
10 tokens of some kind - preferably rings, necklaces, photos, a pocket watch, a rosary or anything else that has personal value, but anything will work
A way to record your story (Journal, Camera, Microphone, ...)


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Alt-Play: Jason Rohrer Anthology
boardgame.description:
http://ds.gamespy.com/nintendo-dsi/alt-play-jason-rohrer-ant...

"Alt-Play brings the best of independent gaming to the Nintendo DSiWare service, introducing players to some of the most unique experiences this medium has to offer.

In this compilation, award-winning game auteur Jason Rohrer's work comes to the Nintendo DSi system, including three of his best games to date: Passage, Gravitation and Between. The deep themes and distinctive presentation in Rohrer's work help to blur the line between visual art and video games, evoking thoughts and emotions rarely associated with gaming."

boardgame.name: Histórias de Pescador (Edição Mini)
boardgame.description:
Histórias de Pescador (Edição Mini) reimplements Histórias de Pescador, but in a small and portable format. The gameplay remains the same as the original.

It is the last fishing season of the year and everyone got together to tell stories of their biggest catch. Anything goes to get the group's admiration and the title of best fisherman.

During his turn, a player must lower at least one card from his hand, face down, and declare a type of fish. The other players can choose to believe or ask for proof. If the other players don't believe him, the player must reveal his card(s) and, depending on whether he is being honest or not, win or lose points.

The game continues with the players until someone successfully discards the last card in their hand, telling their last story and becoming the best fisherman in the group.

--description from publisher

boardgame.name: Pájaros en el Alambre
boardgame.description:
The title Pájaros en el Alambre means Birds on the Wire. The game consists of cards with ten different birds, all armed with guns.
At the beginning of the game, a wire with 10 different birds is laid out on the table. During their turn, a player may choose to either exchange a card from their hand with a card on the wire; or move a card on the wire to the left or right (as stated on the card). Each kind of bird has a requirement as to how many of them must be adjacent to another to form a set. When a player creates a set, they take out those birds as score cards and replace them with cards from the pile. When the wire cannot be refilled, the player with most points is the winner.

boardgame.name: Antes del Diluvio
boardgame.description:
Antes del Diluvio (a.k.a. "Before the Flood") takes place in the year 2070, just twelve hours before the extinction of the last living creatures on Earth. Robots that now rule the Earth are determined to gather different kinds of DNA as long as it is still available so that they can eventually recreate life on other planets.

Each hour is played as one round. On your turn, you have four action points to draw DNA tiles from different bags, put them into their incubator, or move them from the incubator to your habitat. The tiles have different shapes and sizes and must be placed to fit the habitat or the incubator. Each round has a different objective which, if fulfilled, gets you victory points. After twelve rounds, the player with most victory points wins.

boardgame.name: BRUJAS DEL SABADO
boardgame.description:
BRUJAS DEL SABADO is a trick-taking game about feasting with four Spanish witches. The player with the most points wins.

The game is a "must follow" experience, but rather than following the suit of the first player, the card played by the second player, and that card's relation to the first card played, will determine the follow type for the round.

The suits are strictly ranked, both in strength and in point value. The winner of a trick must make an adjustment to the strength of the winning suit, and the players will each draft a card played to the trick to their score pile.

At the end of the game, players will earn points based upon both the suits collected and the ranks collected.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Yoidore Omomuki Miyatsuko (酔いどれ趣造)

boardgame.name: Coup: Bufão e Burocrata
boardgame.description:
The buffoon or "Bobo da Corte" is a promo card used to replace the Ambassador card.

A player who claims the role of the Jester can cause Disorder by taking a card from the Court deck and a target card (another player of his choice). The player can secretly change one of his cards between one of the two cards received. The player returns a card to the Court deck and a card to his target (the player he had chosen).

The target may also claim that the player does not have the role of the Jester and thus prevent him from having a stolen card and that the Jester himself collects a card from the Court deck.

If the target has a Captain's card, the Captain can claim the Jester in order to block the card's theft.

"The Bureaucrat" is a promo card used to replace the Duke (Duke) card.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Coup: Deluxe Edition

boardgame.name: In The Light Of Death The Demon Cries
boardgame.description:
CONTENT WARNING:

This game features the following concepts and themes: demons, fatal violence, the killing of innocents, grief, betrayal, death, and inescapable evil. While this game focuses on the light of hope at the core of despair, these themes should be carefully considered and may cause distress or be triggering.



This Is A Game You Play Alone

This game offers you the chance to create your own story of horror, despair, regret, and sin. You will create your demon, one recovered memory at a time. The Demon may find redemption, or they may be finally consumed by a hell of their own making.

The Demon is dying. There is no coming back from that.

This isn’t about overcoming death. This is about finding humanity, and creating, or denying, a path to salvation and forgiveness.

Will your Demon rediscover their humanity and recover bittersweet memories, accepting reincarnation?

Or will they spend their last moments cursing humanity, waiting for hell to claim what’s left of their soul?

Or does another fate await them?



The Inspiration

This story game’s main inspiration is the anime series Demon Slayer (Kimetsu no Yaiba, 鬼滅の刃). The story’s protagonist, Tanjiro Kamado, shows great compassion and mercy to the demons he kills. He kills them to protect innocents and stop their reign of terror. But he understands that these demons were humans once, and have lost their way.

I created this game to reflect the moments of haunting humanity we see as the demon dies. We see glimpses of the demon’s life as a human, their slow and terrible corruption, and the unanswered question: what awaits the demon in death?

I offer this game to you, to create your own story of horror and answer the question: what does redemption ask for?

This game is based on the Wretched & Alone system, and was made for the Wretched & Alone Jam!



The Game

To play this game you will need a tarot deck and a tumbling blocks tower. You can play with a free phone app or website if you don't have access to those.

To play simply draw from your tarot deck and refer to the memory oracle. As the memories are uncovered, record these memories and how your Demon feels about them. Some of these memories are powerful, and will bring Death closer, asking you to pull from the tower. Each question you are asked will help you create a beautiful story.

When the tower falls, your Demon dies.

Depending on what cards you pulled, a specific ending awaits your Demon, open to your interpretation.

Source: The Developer Website.
boardgame.rpg: In The Light Of Death The Demon Cries

boardgame.name: INSOMNIA Re: DEATH
boardgame.description:
Navigate between the real world (the Real) and the realm of dreams (the Dream) as the nightmares are real. You have been suffering some insomnia and the veil between world has cause them to blur. Will you face the darkness and emerge back in the Real? Or does the nightmares of both realities come crashing down and send you deep into the void?

INSOMNIA Re: DEATH is a single-player journal-recording RPG using the Wretched & Alone system and game jam. Through a series of personal reflections, obstacles, and encounters, the player will determine their fate, unless the nightmares get to them first.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Into Blue Midnight
boardgame.description:
The expedition was going so well, but at 3,000 feet below the surface, when the ocean turns from blue to black, everything goes wrong.



Something cracks. Water starts to fill at your feet. The crane at the surface jams. The radio line goes quiet. And now the two of you are alone, only a few layers of steel and a quartz window to keep you from death.



You have one hour of oxygen left.



Conserve breath, repair the bathysphere as much as you can, record what you see in the blue midnight of the ocean...and hope that you will see the surface again.



Inspired by the voyage of the bathysphere and the world's first deep sea dive, Into Blue Midnight is a GMless two-player Wretched and Alone game that lets you play out the last hour of two scientists within the bathysphere when everything goes wrong.

All it requires are two players, a single six-sided die, a standard deck of cards, a block tower, some tokens, pen and paper, and a container of water.

Content Warning: this game deals heavily with themes of death, drowning, and despair, and has a high likelihood of player character death

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Rack-Stack
boardgame.description:
Rack-Stack is played on a diamond-shaped grid of 16 spaces. Each player has eight pieces in their color.

One unusual feature of the game is that the players must pretend that the board is vertical; a piece can only be placed if it is supported on both "lower" sides by other pieces or the board edges.

The other unusual feature is that players may play pieces of either color. However, at the end of the game players only score for their own pieces.

Scoring is for sets of three pieces at the points of an equilateral triangle. These can be made in three sizes which are worth from one to three points.

boardgame.name: Justice for Bambi(no)
boardgame.description:
You play beings of the forest, driven by the same force. You’re all friends. You respect each other. You love each other. And you know the suffering of this lonely father who now has to raise his child alone.


Justice for Bambi(no) is a game about hunting, where you’re hunting the hunter while being afraid. As simple as that: you’re non-human animals, you saw one of your friends murdered. You know that hunting a hunter can only end badly, but you have to do something.

This game requires candles, audio recorder and six-sided dice.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Magical Malfeasance
boardgame.description:
You were a regular high-school girl, going about her normal day-to-day life... ...Until you made a wrong turn.


While taking a shortcut home, you encounter a monster. An abomination that makes your blood run cold. As it looms over you. Its maw inches from your face, a glimmering crystal appears and offers you salvation.


Alas. The crystal lied.



Now, as a newly minted Magical Girl, you must fight your way through the nightmarish cycle of monsters to hunt down The Core– the demonic source at the beginning and end of this onslaught– to obliterate The Cycle, and your accursed crystal, before they might do the same unto you.



As you struggle with all your magical might to destroy monsters and reach The Core in the hope of ending the cycle of suffering perpetuated by the crystal, you must survive daily life as both a magical and normal girl.


Magical Malfeasance is a single-player journaling TTRPG based on the "Wretched And Alone" system.

The game is played with a deck of cards and a falling block tower. However, this falling block tower is split into two separate towers.

One tower represents your vitality; the other represents how close the monsters are to tracking you down.

Successfully managing these two towers as you move blocks between them might just be the key to vanquishing The Core.

In mere days, try as you may to trudge through an eternity of magic and corruption, and cling to the once-peaceful life you hold dear.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Murder!
boardgame.description:
The Party at The Manor was supposed to be a fun night for all involved - and it was, until The Host was brutally murdered!

All the Guests are locked inside, and there is a Killer on the loose. Each hour brings a new gruesome murder - and only you, The Detective, can solve the case before it's too late!


Murder! is a solo RPG about trying to solve a mystery while struggling to stay alive - knowing fully well that death hides in every corner, nobody is safe, and everybody has secrets to hide.

It is inspired by murder mysteries such as Clue (the board game and the 1985 movie), Knives Out, and the entire Agatha Christie body of work - with a tiny pinch of Hereditary, Seven and Hannibal thrown in to keep things interesting!

You are likely to die, and unlikely to be remembered.


Content Warning: Enclosed inside, you will find themes that can relate to murder, violence, animal harm, occultism, blood, body harm.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: ASL Comp: Hindenburg Line – Battle of Vierstraat Ridge 1918
boardgame.description:
VIERSTRAAT RIDGE, BELGIUM, 2 SEPTEMBER 1918: The Hindenburg Line was originally organized for defense toward the end of the year 1916, and work was continuous in its preparation for a long time thereafter.
The Siegfried Line makes full use, along extended stretches, of the front line of defense accorded by the Bellicourt-St. Quentin Canal.
The strength of these defenses, increased as it is by inundated areas, provided extensive mutual flanking fire support. Good artillery observation rendered the line very strong. The Siegfried Line is considered to create the most favorable conditions for a stubborn defense by a minimum garrison. It is therefore adapated to the requirements of obstinate close combat.

Ownership of GWASL 1 and GWASL 3 are required, as is your ASL-RB.
All the other combat counters needed to play are provided in the form of 648 color die-cut counters.

Scenarios:
Vierstraat, Belgium

boardgame.name: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Terror stalks the nightmare realms of Ravenloft. No one knows this better than monster scholar Rudolph Van Richten. To arm a new generation against the creatures of the night, Van Richten has compiled his correspondence and case files into this tome of eerie tales and chilling truths.

• Travel (perhaps even by choice) to Ravenloft's expanded Domains of Dread—each domain with its own unique flavor of horror, thrilling story hooks, and grisly cast of characters
• Craft your own D&D horror settings, add tension with optional rules, and get advice for running a game that's ghastly in all the right ways
• Create characters with lineages tied to vampires, undead, and hags, horror-themed subclasses, the Investigator background, and "Dark Gifts" that may be a double-edged sword
• Unleash nightmarish monsters from an expanded bestiary, and browse a collection of mysterious trinkets
• Explore Ravenloft in the included Dungeons & Dragons adventure—play as a stand-alone adventure or drop it into your current game for a bit of sinister fun

Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft: House of Lament 02
Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft: House of Lament 03
Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft: House of Lament 04

boardgame.name: Hawker Life
boardgame.description:
Hawker Life is a game for everyone who enjoys the hawker experience, just as we do. From the variety of food to the hustle and bustle, we aim to keep this unique culture alive in all our hearts!

From collaboration to competition, fresh-faced newbies to roughed-up veterans, our game mirrors what hawkers face as they go about their business. In this game, it’ll be a battle of wits to see who comes out as the Head Hawker by opening all the stalls in front of you!

The objective of the game is to be the first to complete all the stalls in front of you.

Collect ingredients to open up the stalls, collaborate with your neighbours to open the food stalls together, and use a variety of action cards to take advantage of your competitors' weaknesses.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Simon's Cat: Total Mess
Simons Katze: Wildes Wirrwarr
boardgame.description:
In Simon's Cat: Total Mess, the deck is composed of pictures with connected drawings and special "Simon's Cat" cards. Players draw cards and lay them in a row until a card with no number in the corner is drawn. The first player to connect objects from the first to the last card and correctly name the last objects gathers all the challenge cards and keeps them. Players guessing incorrectly return a card to the deck. When a special Simon's Cat card comes up, the first player to shout "Simon's Cat!" wins the card for extra points at the end of the game.

The game stops when all the cards in the deck have been used. The player with the most points wins.

listing.notes: Title: Simon's Cat: Total Mess Publisher: MDR Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Clash of Decks: Starter Kit
boardgame.description:
You are a surviving Sorcerer-Lord from the Erret Archipelago. A territory where hundreds of islands are connected together by huge bridges. Bridges once conferred the Archipelago greatness and prosperity, and permitted flourishing trade between its islands. The Archipelago's wealth, which would only transit through these bridges, offered every resident a life of comfort and carefreeness. But today, overpopulation, natural resources depletion, and blind cupidity from the Lord-Sorcerers have created a cataclysmic imbalance in the Erret Archipelago. Not a day goes by without the earth ripping apart and the seas engulfing the most fragile islands. The Sorcerer-Lords now fight for control of the upper and safest islands of the Archipelago. To survive in these hostile lands, you need to cross the bridges and fight other Sorcerer-Lords to claim their land.

Clash of Deck: Starter Kit is a card-based combat game for 1-2 players aged 8+ that plays in 15-30 minutes, created by Léandre Proust, with artwork from Studio Rexard, and published by Grammes Édition. Create your 8 unit army and battle other Lord-Sorcerers to destroy their Strongholds!

Clash of Deck is dead… Long lives Clash of Decks! Clash of Decks is a card game which has been played and tested by hundreds of players throughout its first year of existence, as a French version. The game was published in 2020 in an atypic form: cards you cut yourself from a folded sheet of cardboard. A new standalone expansion was published each month. Today, thanks to the feedback and support of its community of players, Clash of Decks takes off with a new edition, available in English. The game will have more conventional components, such as "real" cards, larger and of better quality, with a tuck box.

boardgame.name: Justice League
boardgame.description:
Unite to fight evil! Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman, Aquaman, Cyborg and Flash join forces to create the Justice League. Together they will fight evil with their super powers and free the world from the attacks of super villains. Advance from city to city eliminating the "Parademons" to reach the final square where only the survivors can face Steppenwolf and try to defeat him. The cooperative Superhero game where strategy makes the difference.
Can be played as a team or solo. A collaborative game against the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Total Extreme Wrestling 2020
boardgame.description:
The award-winning TEW franchise by Adam Ryland and Grey Dog Software returns with the eighth installment, Total Extreme Wrestling 2020. The biggest and best version yet, TEW 2020 takes all the prime cuts from its very popular predecessors and adds well over 250 brand new features and changes to give the ultimate TEW experience. More user friendly, this is the perfect version for newcomers to the series to start off with.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Hellboy: The Board Game – Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
Hellboy: The Board Game is a co-operative experience in which players face off against some of the comic's most famous foes. Up to four people take control of iconic BPRD members, such as Hellboy, Abe Sapien, and Roger the Homunculus, then explore gothic locations and uncover ancient artifacts.

The game features pre-assembled plastic miniatures that accurately capture the look and feel of Mike Mignola's world famous comic series.


Deluxe Edition includes:

Hellboy: The Board Game

boardgame.name: Blitz-Spiel
boardgame.description:
The players start with one pawn at space 1 and go to space 50 and change to the round course from space I to XII. Movement is determined by one or two dice. One or more pawns may occupy each space with the exception of spaces II, V, VIII and XI.

If a pawn stands on one of these 4 spaces, lightning stikes all other pawns standing on the same lightning bolt, eliminating them from the game. Then the pawn, that initiated the lightning strike starts anew from space 1.

If a meeple reaches space 50 exactly, it starts anew at space 1.

The player with the last pawn in play wins the game.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

boardgame.name: Myraclia: Eternity
boardgame.description:
Eternal powers...waiting on Myraclia...hidden from the eyes of the mighty...but generously revealed to those who appear feeble

- - - RULES - - -

CONTENT: 16 double-sided Eternity Tokens

SETUP: Just place all Eternity tokens back-side up next to the scoring board.

RULES: At the end of each round (except the last round), the last player on the scoreboard (in case of a tie, tied player who terraformed later in this round) randomly selects one token and places the token on any free Myraclia tile (i.e. not terraformed, not reserved), face-up.

Remember: Myraclia with Eternity token placed on it is available to all players in the subsequent rounds.

Depending on the type of Eternity token, the player who terraforms Myraclia hex with Eternity token (or more tokens) placed on it gains a certain advantage/bonus.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Myraclia

boardgame.name: Myraclia: Darkness
boardgame.description:
Not all parts of Myraclia are life welcoming... there are some deep dark voids you rather don't want to be close to... they do not allow you to shape Myraclia according to your visions ...so it is much better if they stand in the path of your opponents.

- - - RULES - - -

CONTENT: 3 Darkness Tiles

SETUP: After the setup (pages 6-8), mix Darkness Tiles with other Myraclia Tiles in the Tiles Supply.

RULES: If the Darkness Tile is drawn from the Tiles Supply, it is placed on Tiles Display like any other Tile. The Player expanding Myraclia surface at the end of their turn must choose Darkness Tile first if there is one available on Tiles Display. Darkness Tiles cannot be terraformed.

Remember: There may not be more than 1 Darkness tile on Tiles Display. If another Darkness Tile is drawn while there is Darkness Tile on Display already, put it back in the bag and draw a replacement.

Important: We recommend using this expansion only for experienced players

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Myraclia

boardgame.name: Alien on Board
boardgame.description:
Log entry 87c. from 03/18/2085: After a successful mission on the Janus ring of Saturn, we have initiated the return flight to Earth. Suddenly the alarm system of our board computer switches on: WARNING ... XF33! Alien on board! We quickly meet on the main deck, the entire crew has appeared. Everyone seems normal.
And yet the measuring devices report "strange biomass activities"! So - One of us has to be the alien! Who can it be? And how are we supposed to expose it? With specific questions we will try to identify the intruder, otherwise this could be the la...

Aim of the game...
...is to unmask the alien or to mislead the crew members by answering, listening and combining the questions.

Gameplay:
Decoding - Survey - Exposure

1. Decoding:
The Commander shuffles the decoders face down and distributes one of them to each player (including the "Alien Decoder"). Then the commander draws the top question card. Nobody is allowed to see who has which decoder.

2. Survey:
The commander pushes the question card into his decoder, silently reads the deciphered words and gives the entire group a short and loud answer.
Then the commander passes the same card on, to the next player, who does the same. This continues until all players (incl. the secret alien) have given an answer.

3. Exposure:
Now, based on the answers, the crew tries to unmask the alien. To do this, everyone votes on the player they believe is the alien in this round.

The points are distributed and a new round starts.

After 10 rounds, the player with the most points is the winner!

boardgame.name: Time Heist
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Pinnacle City!
World-renowned, award-winning RPG writer/designer Eddy Webb brings you a fast-pased introductory adventure for Prowlers & Paragons Ultimate Edition.

Apes... why did it have to be apes?!
Time Heist is an adventure for 3-5 Standard Level heroes, introducing some key Villains from the Pinnacle City Universe (PCU) while giving new players a solid first-time-out adventure experience for the game mechanics. Time Heist is an adventure in three parts:

Part One: A bank heist with a time manipulating speedster named Crime Spree.
Part Two: Innocent people and animals in the way at the local zoo as Shard wrecks havoc and tries to get in the way of the Heroes.
Part Three: The exciting conclusion as a horde of apes and simians, led by the myterious "Mister X," finally reveals the crucial plot to dominate the future from the past.

boardgame.name: Crisis Control
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Modern Gods Universe!

World-renowned, award-winning RPG writer/designer Sean Patrick Fannon (AKA "Big Irish") brings you a fast-pased introductory adventure for Prowlers & Paragons Ultimate Edition.

A World With Paranormals Becomes a Paranormal World

A loud, destructive attack against a jet engine engineering facility in Northern Scotland. Multiple impossible dsisasters wrack Ho Chi Min City, Viet Nam.

Someone's taking "corporate warfare" to a new extreme, but to what end?

Crisis Control is a three-part scenario for Prowlers & Paragons Ultimate Edition. It's intended for 5-7 Heroes o the Standard Power Level - you can literally grab the Heroes from the back of the P&PUE core book and you're good to go.

Crisis Control, written by P&PUE co-designer Sean Patrick Fannon (High Tech Enemies, Savage Rifts, Freedom Squadron) gives you...

Fourteen fully-fleshed, illustrated villains - three complete teams!
An extraordinary introduction to the P&P Disaster Rules!
Your first experience with the Modern Gods Universe (MGU), SPF's decades-in-the-making superhero setting.

boardgame.name: Fußball-Wettspiel
boardgame.description:
Each player has 11 tokens which are placed on the black spots on the game board. Movement is determined by a die according to following special rules:

1 - The goal keeper (T) moves forward one space diagonaly. If the keeper leaves the penalyty box, the opponent rolls two times, on a result of 8 or more, he sets the nearest forward- or midfield player on a red spot and scores a goal and the keeper is reset to his starting point.

3 - One of the three midfield players (L) moves 3 spaces in a straight line from his starting point.

4 - One of the five forward players (S) moves 4 spaces in a straight line from his starting point.

2 and 5 - A forward or midfield player not standing on his starting point moves 2 or 5 spaces.

6 - A defense player (V) moves 2 spaces diagonaly forward. If a defense player passes line A, the opponent gets a free turn.

Every time a forward- or midfield player reaches a red spot near the goal of the opponent, a goal is scored and the token remains there for the rest of the game. The first player to score all 8 goals wins the game.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

boardgame.name: One Piece: Pour une poignée de berrys
boardgame.description:
The most famous characters of the manga clash in this One Piece game!

Luffy and his friends have set themselves a challenge: collect as many Berrys as possible. For this they are ready to do anything in this beautiful board game One Piece!

The goal of the game? To collect as many Berrys as possible in order to reach first the objective received at the beginning of the game. To do this, each player will have to use their ACTION cards and foil their opponents' attacks. He will also be able to recover the treasures collected by his opponents. Beware, the powers of the characters will make the game full of twists and turns!

And to prolong the adventure, Obyz has created the One Piece For a Fistful of Berrys expansion!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: One Piece: Extension – Pour une poignée de berrys: Les 7 Grands Corsaires

boardgame.name: Langskip
boardgame.description:
Langskip is a 2-4 player bluffing game. You are a Viking who has been mistakenly sent to the realm of Helheim, usually reserved for those who died dishonourably. It becomes a race to Asgard before your fellow Vikings to convince Odin that you should be allowed entry into the glorious golden hall of Valhalla!

On your turn, you can use the power of the gods to guide you through the four realms quicker than your opponents by playing one of the two cards in your hand face down. Still, the other players must choose whether to believe that you played the card you said or accuse you of mischief and reveal the card for everyone to see. If your accusation is successful, you gain a mischief token; if you lie successfully without being accused, you gain a mischief token. Mischief tokens are used to make Loki and his children stronger, giving you an even better chance of arriving at Asgard first.

Will you be mischievous, or will you keep everyone on the worthy path and reap the benefits of their ill-deeds?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: One Piece: Extension – Pour une poignée de berrys: Les 7 Grands Corsaires
boardgame.description:
A One Piece expansion that comes with new cards to renew your One Piece board game For a Fistful of Berrys.

The rules remain the same as for the base game (except that you can only play event cards of the same type once per turn). The 7 CHARACTER cards will allow you to play with new powers. The characters remain iconic like Doflamingo.

The new ACTION cards will diversify the game to make it even more explosive! Play for example the "Longue-Vue" card which will allow you to steal the card of your choice from one of your opponents.

Included! A cloth bag with One Piece colors to store your One Piece board game.

Attention! Requires the One Piece game For a handful of Berrys.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: One Piece: Pour une poignée de berrys

boardgame.name: Tribes of Everglow (Multi)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A detailed look into the minds and societies of all the varied pony tribes of Everglow. See how they view each other and the other races of the world, how they handle birth, life, and death, and their unique perspectives shown in contrast with one another. Now compatible with Pathfinder 1st and 2nd edition and 5th edition of that game with dragons in it!

Over a hundred new feats
Class Archetypes
Dozens of Alchemy Discoveries
Rogue tricks
Prestige class
New equipment
New spells
New Lore and history
Two whole new tribes, the short legs and the protoponies.

boardgame.name: The Raum Virus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What happens when a computer virus gets a supernatural boost? The mysterious Summoner blackmails your fellow classmates abroad. Who is this villain and how will you stop them?

boardgame.name: Finding the Five
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your party has located magical necklaces and information that believe means the items control Golems of a specific kind. Other information garnered in your prior foray has given you a bit of an old map that may lead you to this magnificent treasure!

Although set in the Pangia Campaign, this adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

boardgame.name: Identity
boardgame.description:
You haven’t always had it easy, but now things are worse. A chance encounter on the street changed your life. It was like looking into a mirror. But surely, you would have known if you had a twin.

You only learned you were a clone 1 month ago. Now, alongside your siblings, you are being hunted by the corporation that created you. You thought you were being smart, you thought you were well hidden, but the corporation is on to you. The corporation knows your location, and you need to run. Thankfully, you know this large city well, and if you talk to the right people you might be able to access all the resources you need. Can you stay hidden long enough to take the corporation down before it kills you and all your siblings?

It’s going to be tough. But someone has to take a stand.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Gray Eminence: Year of Chaos
boardgame.description:
The good, the bad, and the ugly of 2020 – the year the hits just kept on coming.

Not since the war years has the world had to work so hard to find succor. As science worked to save us, creativity and ingenuity became our tools of survival during the stresses of lockdown. But for some dark masters, our Annus Horribilis brought new opportunities…

Revisit the secret world of the Gray Eminences, in this expansion to the innovative base game of manipulations and administrations. Become the power behind the thrones that suddenly no-one wished to sit on.

Annus Horribilities turned in to an expansion. No rule changes, but just more of the high-quality content!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Gray Eminence

boardgame.name: Outer Planet Panic
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Outer Planet Panic, the game of archeology in space, where you play an institution that is racing with your opponents to become the first to reverse engineer and activate alien technology. In the distant future man has expanded beyond the stars and has found a galaxy where several advanced civilizations lived. Through initial research, it has been discovered that they created several great advancements, some of which you have found.

You think you know what you need to create the device but now you must search through planets, debris fields, and radioactive areas of space in order to find the components needed to put the devices together. The galactic museum is willing to help, for a price. You can also hire workers to help you or hinder your opponents, buy equipment to make digging and research easier, and be careful because bad luck or good luck can strike at any time in the vast emptiness of space.

You start out by given fund from your sponsors to explore and dig up ancient alien artifacts Depending on your D-12 Dice role. The goal is to collect seven specific items, Research them, activate them and once you have collected 7 of said items you can try to activate the ultimate Device using the cards and take over the galaxy.

Beware, the other players may use spies to Saratoga your items, They or you can dig up gadgets from the space ship salvage yard. Sell items to do more deal making and there are events that can inhibit or help you each cycle. To help you with your mission you can hire freelancers sell items to the research academy. But be careful you might be selling somethings the other players needs.

Work together to stab each other in the back. Make deals, Saratoga your friends. Be the first to develop the ultimate device to win the game! Included are 6 planets, a space port, black hole, item cards, Event cards, personal cards, equipment cards, the ultimate device cards, player pieces and sponsors cards. The game also included 6 D-12. Starsmanught base worlds and more!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Vindication: Community Promo Pack 2
boardgame.description: 15 promotional cards inspired by backer's concepts during the Vindication: Chronicles Kickstarter campaign.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Vindication

boardgame.name: Forgotten Waters: DLC Pack 1 – Kraken's Eye
boardgame.description:
Cap'n Lory ain't got experience or smarts, but that ain't gonna stop him from bein' the greatest, most legendary pirate who ever sailed the seas — and he's got the perfect plan to do it, too: Sail through a never-endin' storm and rip a magical eye out o' Hellmaw, the legendary kraken who lives there.

As a member o' the senior crew in Forgotten Waters: DLC Pack 1 – Kraken's Eye, you get to help the captain on this treacherous mission. Lucky you! Sure, some folk would shy away from such a task, but with Lory's leadership, nothin' could go wrong! If only Spooky Jed would stop goin' on about the end o' the world. Oh, no matter! It's probably nothin'!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Forgotten Waters

boardgame.name: Script Terror
boardgame.description:
You are the director of a B terror movie, but you have concurrence. You must run to to show your movie in to the audience before your opponents. Gather the perfect crew, find a suitable location and delay your opponents efforts on these funny card game.

Each turn the player buys a card from a shared deck of cards containing all types of cards (from actors to locations) or the top card from the discard pile, and see if the card fits in his goals (according to his script card, some sort of objective card).

After that, the active player must use one action card or discard a card.

The first player to fulfill his script cart is the winner.

The game was self published by the author after a successful Catarse (the equivalent of KS in Brazil) campaign.

boardgame.name: Tiny Taverns: A La Carte
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the first expansion for Tiny Taverns, “A La Carte” introduces new options for your chaotic and heartwarming slice-of-life fantasy games in the tavern you create together!

From new mini-games, guidelines for “combatless” play, and brand new denizens, plot hooks, and heritage rules, there’s something on the menu for every group.

boardgame.name: DiceDek
boardgame.description: The objective of the game is to be the first player to play off all of his/her cards and go out. The game makes use of a custom set of 36 numbered cards, six jokers, and two dice. The cards are first dealt evenly to all of the players. On their turn, a player rolls a dice and tries to match the dice with the cards he/she has that are of the same denomination, which is then placed in the discard pile. If he is able to discard, he throws again until he can no longer discard any cards, at which point the dice (and play) passes to the next player. Numbers are divided into blocked and free numbers. Free numbers can be used by other players to discard their cards if the player whose turn it was could not discard his/her cards. Blocked numbers can only be used by the player throwing the dice. Jokers serve as wild cards.

boardgame.name: iKnow Edycja Rodzinna
iKnow Perhe
boardgame.description:
A family version of a popular quiz game iKnow. ("Edycja Rodzinna" is Polish for "Family Edition".)

Like in other games from this series, to win you need more than knowledge. You have to know your opponents well in order to predict how they will answer their questions. In the family edition of iKnow, this factor is more important than it was before, because you will not only bet if your opponent answers correctly or not, but also you will have a chance to outsmart your rivals. In this edition, you choose one out of four answers.

boardgame.name: SINoALICE
boardgame.description:
Up, down, left, right... Here, it’s all the same.
Books are piled high in every direction.
Welcome to the “Library.”
A space ruled by stories and words.
The sounds of penitent sobs, mournful howls, withering laughter, and terrible screams rebounding off the shelves.

These are the voices of characters from countless tales.
The muttered curses of the inhuman.
They all share a single wish:
To revive their Author.
But for this simple wish to come true, every other character must die.

No matter what tragic ending that may bring...

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Birdie
boardgame.description:
In Birdie, play as a silly bird-golfer with a unique ability and jump on to the golf course!

Create your own terrains using brilliant modular tiles or play on over 18 different premade terrains. Select your clubs wisely or push your luck to complete the courses in the fewest strokes possible! Beware of sand pits, water ponds, and many other natural obstacles if you want to avoid any penalties!

On your turn, play a card from your hand or push your luck with the first card of the deck. Then, add any card with the same value to boost your stroke even further. Caddies will let you add another card to the mix, and wedges will help you get out of the sand. The higher the value of your stroke, the further your ball will go! With trees to bounce off your ball, hills to change where it lands, and other golfers messing around the course, each game creates its own story.

Choose the game length by playing 6, 9 or 18 holes and test your skills to elect the new champion!

Play with 4 others concurrents, in teams, or simply try to beat your own score in solitaire. Birdie offers a simple and quick gameplay that truly lives up to the experience of Golf.

-description from designer

offers enough challenges for advanced players as well.

You’ll draw maps, roll dice, pull cards from a deck, and make a living record of the city and its people.

boardgame.description:
A direct sequel to Uprising: Join or Die

After a century of bloody galactic battle, a horde of intelligent bloodthirsty aliens, known as the Kri'iSara, threaten to exterminate all human life. New Alliance Command is counting on you to destroy the alien menace. Lead your combined forces from a second-generation Wraith battle tank.

boardgame.description:
A collection of scenarios from various fronts and time.

The Blowtorch Battalion - Near the River Udy, Ukraine, February 12th 1943

boardgame.name: Jellybeans
boardgame.description:
Jellybeans is played with a standard deck of cards, minus the court cards. Each player is assigned a color (with two players) or a suit (with more; with three one suit is removed).

Players receive hands of five cards and take turns drawing and then playing one card (or discarding and drawing three cards). Cards are placed in five "baskets" (rows of cards) - the cards represent packages of jellybeans.

When each basket has four cards the game is over. Each basket scores for the owner of the suit with the most jellybeans (pips); the score is the total number of jellybeans plus the number of different flavors (suits).

Each of the four quarterly issues may cover topics such as:

Advice for convention-goers, whether you have a disability or are just trying to be aware of others.
Guidance for how to accommodate people with disabilities in your games.
Advice for respectfully playing disabled characters.
First-looks and reviews of tabletop games with an emphasis on accessibility.
Tips on how to adapt certain game mechanics for various purposes.
Interviews with disabled game designers.
Important news and resources related to accessibility in gaming.
Art by disabled illustrators.
And more.
